intro: Stackhousia flava, commonly known as the yellow stackhousia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, also known as the legume or pea family. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and produces clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers. Its leaves are trifoliate, consisting of three oval-shaped leaflets. Stackhousia flava is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to well-drained soils in full sun.
